Articles.Content:
Is there an option somewhere in Tweakscale to advise it that I KNOW that the version for KSP 1.12.4 isn't rated to work on KSP 1.12.5 and it can stop telling me every time I start the game? I can't seem to find one...

 

-K
It has an auto timer afaik

On 1/15/2023 at 5:21 PM, Professor K said:

Is there an option somewhere in Tweakscale to advise it that I KNOW that the version for KSP 1.12.4 isn't rated to work on KSP 1.12.5 and it can stop telling me every time I start the game? I can't seem to find one...

Hi!

Not so long time ago, a new KSP release broke TS in a horrible way and caused some carnage in the field. Since that time I choose to warn the user when a untested KSP is in use with TweakScale to warn them about the (hypothetical) danger and so give them a chance to backup everything - just in case.

Usually a new TS release follows a new KSP release in a few days - a new TweakScale release is currently available on the TS thread.

Currently available on github and CurseForge. SpaceDock and CKAN will be updated Friday.

12 hours ago, Lisias said:

Hi!

Not so long time ago, a new KSP release broke TS in a horrible way and caused some carnage in the field. Since that time I choose to warn the user when a untested KSP is in use with TweakScale to warn them about the (hypothetical) danger and so give them a chance to backup everything - just in case.

Usually a new TS release follows a new KSP release in a few days - a new TweakScale release is currently available on the TS thread.

Currently available on github and CurseForge. SpaceDock and CKAN will be updated Friday.

Thanks Lisias. I understand the why behind the warning, I was just hoping for a way to turn it off.   And thanks for the heads up on the new release, I hadn't seen it as last I looked.

-K
